comment.author: 27070380@N03
comment._content: I found a link from Saskatchewan Archives Board Photo Blog and found this one. Would this be one of Rafton's creations?? Downtown Lethbridge 19?? taken from First Central School?? sabphotos.wordpress.com/2010/02/02/location-4/#comments
comment.authorname: The Lost Canuck Photography by Cody Kapcsos

comment.author: 23686862@N03
comment._content: Hi Cody, you bet it is. Good spotting! we've added notes to the photo above of 4 of the 6 buildings we have identified on the SAB photo blog.  Thanks!
comment.authorname: Galt Museum & Archives on The Commons

comment.author: 57873306@N00
comment._content: I don’t understand the addresses in your notes. The AGT building appears to be across from the Chinook Club yet their addresses have them as blocks apart. The AGT building appears to be a block away from Knox, but according to your notes, they should be on the same block.

comment.author: 23686862@N03
comment._content: The photograph was taken from the top of the water standpipe which was located on the west side of the T-intersection at 5 Avenue South and Stafford Drive South. The downward angle of the photograph does distort the distances between buildings, making some appear closer together than they are.
comment.authorname: Galt Museum & Archives on The Commons

comment.author: 76774906@N00
comment._content: Such an amazing archive.  It is so good to see Lethbridge in its early days.  I was very familar with this place in the 1950s and 60s.
